Extract class lists for schools using class or registration group structures

Source: R/class_list.R
extract_class_list_classes_groups.Rd

This function creates a detailed class list for schools where teaching groups are organised by *classes* or *registration groups* rather than by subjects. It compiles student, class, and teacher information for the specified year code(s) across all schools included in the provided Wonde dataset list.

Usage

extract_class_list_classes_groups(
  WondeData,
  schools,
  yearCodes,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

WondeData

A named list of school datasets, typically generated by Wonde data retrieval functions (e.g., get_primary_school_student_data). Each element represents one school's full dataset.

schools

A data frame containing metadata for the schools, including at least the columns:

id

Wonde school ID (matches names of WondeData)

urn

Unique Reference Number

classes

Indicator or description of whether class data are available

registration_groups

Indicator or description of whether registration group data are available

yearCodes

Character vector of year codes identifying the students to include (e.g. c("YR", "R") for Reception, "Y1" for Year 1, etc.).

verbose

Logical (default = TRUE). Whether to print progress messages and warnings for missing or inconsistent data.

Value

A data frame containing class list information for the selected year code(s) across all schools, with columns:

SchoolId

Wonde school ID

SchoolName

School name

EstablishmentNumber

Establishment number from Wonde

URN

Unique Reference Number

UPN

Unique pupil number (if available)

StudentId

Wonde student ID

StudentFirstName

Student forename

StudentLastName

Student surname

DoB

Student date of birth (YYYY-MM-DD)

ClassId

Class or registration group ID

ClassName

Class or group name/code

TeacherId

Teacher’s Wonde ID

TeacherForeName

Teacher’s forename

TeacherSurName

Teacher’s surname

TeacherName

Combined teacher name

Details

The function supports two data structures:

  • Class structure: where students are linked via students_classes.

  • Registration group structure: where students are linked via students_group with groups.data__type == "REGISTRATION".

The function first attempts to build the class list using the students_classes dataset. If no valid class data are available for a school, it falls back to using registration group data from students_group. Warnings are issued for schools or students that cannot be matched across datasets.

See also

extract_class_list for the version that uses subject-based structures (typically for secondary schools).

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Extract Reception class lists across all schools using class/group structures
reception_classes <- extract_class_list_classes_groups(
  WondeData = school_data_raw,
  schools = schools_metadata,
  yearCodes = c("R", "YR")
)

# Extract Year 1 class lists
y1_classes <- extract_class_list_classes_groups(
  WondeData = school_data_raw,
  schools = schools_metadata,
  yearCodes = "Y1"
)
} # }
